page.title: 03ALL SAINTS WOOLLEY. >
page.content: There are two services a month, 1st.Sunday 9.00a.m. 3rd Sunday 6.15p.m . Vicar is Rector V.Rogers. Woolley is a small village.In Norman times Woolley used to be called Wilege and it is mentioned in the Domesday Book.It then belonged to Bathwick on the edge of the city of Bath.Several years ago it was joined to the parish of Swainswick. There are 105 people on the electoral roll.Nothing is left of the Norman church at Woolley.It was rebuilt in an Italian style designed by John Wood the younger,who was buried at St.Mary the Virgin Swainswick.
